ARABIC: وَٱذْكُرْ إِسْمَٰعِيلَ وَٱلْيَسَعَ وَذَا ٱلْكِفْلِ وَكُلٌّ مِّنَ ٱلْأَخْيَارِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Remember Our slaves Ismail, Al-Yasa' and Dhu'l-Kifl; each of them was among the best of men.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And remember Ishmael, Elisha and Dhu'l-Kifl. Every one of them is among the best.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And remember Ishmael, Elisha, and Dhu al-Kifl. All were of the best.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Recall Ismael, Elisha, and Dhulkifl (Ezekiel) who were all virtuous people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And remember Ismail and Yasa’a (Elisha) and Zul-Kifl; and they are all excellent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And remember Isma`il, Al-Yasa`, and Dhul-Kifl, all are among the best.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And remember Ismail and Al-Yasha and Zulkifl; and they were all of the best.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Remember also Our servants Ishmael, Elisha, and Dhul Kifl; each is among the excellent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And make mention of Ishmael and Elisha and Dhu'l-Kifl. All are of the chosen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Remember [Our servants] Ishmael, Elisha, and Dhu'l-Kifl. Each of them was among the just.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And remember Isma'il and Al-Yas'a and Zul-kifl: all of the excellent ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And remember Ishmael, Elisha and Dhu’l-Kifl—each [of whom was] among the elect.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And remember Isma'il (Ishmael), Al-Yasa'a (Elisha), and Dhul-Kifl (Isaiah), all are among the best.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Also, remember our worshipers Ishmael, Elisha, and ThulKifl, they are among the good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And mention Ishmael, Elisha, and Ezekiel; all are among the outstanding.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And remember Ishmael, Elisha and Dhul-Kifl, and all are among the outstanding.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [38:48] And mention [also] Our servants Ishmael, and Elisha, who was a prophet (the lām [here in al-Yasa‘] is extra) and Dhū’l-Kifl — there is disagreement over whether he was a prophet; it is said that [he was so called because] he looked after (kafala) a hundred prophets who had sought refuge with him from being killed. Each, that is, every one of them, was among the excellent (akhyār is the plural of khayyir).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And make mention of Ishmael and Elisha) the cousin of Ilyas (and Dhu'l-Kifl) who appointed himself as a guarantor of a few things which belonged to some people and kept his word; it is also said that he took charge of 10O Prophets and he fed them until Allah saved them from death. However, he was a righteous man and not a prophet. (All are of the chosen) in Allah's sight.
